\maketitle


\begin{abstract}
Muon colliders might greatly extend the energy frontier of collider physics.
One can contemplate circular colliders with center-of-mass energies in 
excess of 10~TeV. Some physics issues that might be relevant at such a 
machine are discussed.
\end{abstract}

\section*{Introduction}

The large mass of the muon compared to that of the electron results in 
a large suppression of bremstrahlung radiation. Consequently it is possible
to consider building circular colliders with energies in the multi-TeV 
regime\cite{muon
author: M. S. Berger
